page.title: 16Tourism in Saxilby Area
page.content: In summer, look over the wall in Bridge Street and you will almost certainly see several cruisers and maybe a narrow boat or 2 moored along the banks of the Fossdyke. All part of Saxilby's waterfront scene (featured in the BBC2 film The Grain Run). Boating holiday makers enjoy a safe, free berth and a chance to visit the well stocked shops or the pubs. They cruise between the Trent at Torksey and Brayford Pool, Lincoln. Visitors can stay in a guest house on Bridge Street. Improved mooring and a picnic site is proposed for the far bank. There is fishing on the Fossdyke, but more so on the River Till. There, the charge is 1 pound a day or fishermen are members of a Rotherham club, living mainly in the steel and mining areas of South Yorshire. There were no matches this year because of weed.
